campaign.story:
It’s one of those things we use every day, yet why do so many towels compromise on absorbency, softness and hygiene?

That’s exactly why we set out to reinvent the fabric from scratch, so we can finally dry off on a fresh, clean towel every day. 




The surface of your towel is the perfect breeding ground for harmful bacteria, viruses, and fungi. Moisture absorbed within the fabric allows these microorganisms to multiply exponentially, making your towel the most infected item in your bathroom.





The inspiration for our patent-pending Sanifabric technology comes from medical science. Antibacterial surfaces are one of the most essential technologies used in hospitals today. 




After years of research and development, we were finally able to implement the same material technology within a usable and durable fabric.





But don’t just take our word for it. Sanitowel’s antibacterial effectiveness has been independently verified by the world’s largest testing company Intertek, using the international AATCC-100 standard. Sanitowel was also verified to maintain its effectiveness even after washing. 








Sanitowel has been tested by real people. Based on their feedback we aimed to create a towel that:
Doesn't get musty
Dries faster
Requires less washing
Feels luxuriously soft





After countless iterations, we finally created the perfect design. Here's what some of our users have to say:










Protect your skin from infections, acne, redness, scarring, enlarged pores and other forms of permanent damage that unnecessarily contribute to aging. 




Sanitowel keeps you protected and has been dermatologically certified.













Create the perfect ending to your everyday shower ritual by drying off with the most absorbent, soft and clean towel you’ll ever use.

campaign.story:
18Chesapeake is a beginner game in the 18xx genre. It allows players to gradually build up skills that they can apply to other more complex 18xx games.  
 The "vintage" alternate art will appear on the reverse side of the board from the basic art--same game, just in a new style.
Revenue track in the same style as the new board! 
Excellent introductory 18xx game and tool for teaching new players 18xx
Simple core 18xx rules
2-6 players (yes, 2-player 18xx!)
Quick play time (2.5-3.5 hours, a “weeknight” game)
Eurogame-style components with clear, easy to understand graphic design
Game components
1 map board with stock market, initial offering, and bank pool (2mm, standard thickness)
Cards: 6 private companies
Cards: 72 public company share certificates
Cards: 31 train cards
Cards: 1 priority deal card
Cards: 6 player order cards (numbered 1-6)
95 tiles (1.5mm thick cardboard)
8 public company charters (card, possible stretch goal to cardboard to match tile thickness)
47 wooden tokens and one wooden round marker (with stickers)
1 revenue track
Packet of paper money to use as a bank (or use your own poker chips as many 18xx players do)
Rule booklet with illustrated examples
STRETCH GOALS
    Double-sided board!
    Blue Crab first player marker!
    Premium wood station marker upgrade!
    Paper money bank!
    Player Aids!
    Premium cards!
    Revenue Track!
    Upgraded cardboard charters!
Shipping
US shipping:  1 copy $14, 3 copies $29, 6 copies $48, 12 copies $96
Worldwide shipping: 1 copy $25, 3 copies $60, 6 copies $90, 12 copies $180
 Classic 18xx board is also included (reverse side) 
Update April 22: Lonny Orgler has posted his Kickstarter for 1824, a game that helped get me interested in 18xx! Lonny has been a steady supporter of All-Aboard Games since it began. Please support him as well if you are looking for a next step in 18xx.
 18Chesapeake is the perfect introduction to 18xx, both for players new to the system and for experienced players alike to teach their friends or for a quick weeknight session.
Simple rules
Simple map
Simple stock chart
Game advancing mechanism (train exports) that ensures that the game moves along, even if players are timid about advancing them
 Since a lot of players would like to learn the 18xx system with one other player, a two-player variant is included. This variant replicates the feel of a multiplayer game. One key difference from the multiplayer game is that all the President's Certificates (the unique stock certificate that the owner holds), is a triple share. 
There are over 200 18xx games from publishers big and small that showcase a wide variety of railroad history and game mechanisms. By learning 18Chesapeake, players will learn the basic systems that can be easily applied to the more complex games. 
Draft Game Rules

updates.update_content:
Since fulfillment of 18Chesapeake, I've been focusing on bringing other titles into mass production at the quality of 18Chesapeake. Since the remainder of the 18Chesapeake Kickstarter copies are shipping with Wave 2, I wanted to send out the latest AAG newsletter to the 18Chesapeake backers. Sign up for the newsletter here. I try to do approximately monthly updates on what is going on with new games and future plans.
http://tinyletter.com/allaboardgames
AAG August Email Newsletter

With the 18Chesapeake Kickstarter fulfillment wrapping up, I am so grateful for your help backing 18Chesapeake. It’s been awesome seeing some of those copies in play already.
If you haven’t had a chance to play your copy yet, I want to make sure you know about the new free online implementation of 18Chesapeake at https://18xx.games/  It is currently in beta, but it a great implementation and the game enforces most rules so if there is some part of the game you have been wanting to try out, it’s a great way to get started. Or just take a look at games other people are playing. 18Chesapeake is getting a lot of play right now!

It's been very rewarding to see the comments and photos of the new games come in to the various channels I follow. People seem to be really happy with the new art and component quality.
Shipping Update
Europe/worldwide shipping is in progress and I expect it to be completed by this week or early next week. Shipping notices should be sent out with the shipments so please check your spam filter if you haven't received an email by next week.

Today is the big day we've been waiting for as I have word that US and Europe backers that the shipments are in process. I understand that the US/CA shipments should be going out by tomorrow and backers should receive tracking (FedEx, then for most of the US,  transfer to USPS for final delivery). I have heard that some EU backers have received tracking and I expect those to start shipping from Germany in the next week. For non-US/CA backers, these will also ship from Germany.
Extra copies of 18Chesapeake, 18MEX, and 1817 will be shipped along with your Kickstarter reward in most cases if I was able to match up orders. The other games available for preorder at all-aboardgames.com will ship later in the year--they are entering the preproduction process.

The freight ships are closing in on their final destinations in the US and Germany and should arrive within about a week. They will be forwarded to the Non-Asia/Australia/New Zealand addresses from there. 
This is a good chance to make any last minute address changes since the fulfillment centers will start the process. Message me within 24 hours if a change is needed. I can still hold orders later to make further changes, but then these might have to go out in a second wave of shipments after the first ones are sent.

Online Playthrough
I'll start with the most immediate news which is that we will be doing the online playthrough today! The game will start about 90 minutes after this update goes out, 11am US Central Time, 6pm Central European Time. Stop by and join the chat if you can!
It will be posted to YouTube for later viewing. The video will be on Chris Whitpan's Game All Nite channel. Chris and Tony Fryer also host a podcast called Wheel Tapping.

While we wait for all the international shipping to happen (still a few weeks of ocean shipping until these reach the US/EU/CA international fulfillment centers), I can at least say that some copies will start appearing for Australia/New Zealand customers very shortly (shipping starting today). Those were air shipped as it didn't make sense to ocean ship this quantity. I'm having the fulfillment centers fulfill orders as they arrive so there will be some gaps between when customers get the games in the different regions--just based on logistics differences.

updates.update_userinfo: Games Have Shipped From the Factory!
updates.update_content:
With all the bad news in the world, we can take a moment for some good news. All the shipments are now sent from the factory!
Australia-New Zealand are being air shipped, should arrive at the fulfillment center soon
Asia are being fulfilled by VFI, should arrive soon
US/Europe/Canada/elsewhere are being ocean shipped and are scheduled to arrive at the fulfillment centers around the end of April. (Canada will take a bit of extra time to reship from US to Canada)

The good news is the factory is up and running and sent me the redone stickers from before Chinese New Year. They look perfect and I'm glad to have waited for that (but if I had only known the extra delays who knows what I would have thought!). But I'm also very eager to get these games into everyone's hands. The factory has the go ahead to assemble and ship the games. Since they have a big backlog of work, they could not commit to a date, but expect they will ship in March. That means the first copies should start arriving in April with fulfillment expected to be complete in May (US/Europe/Canada will take the longest due to ocean shipping times).

Just a quick update to let you all know that the factory is closed this week due to the Coronavirus. They expect the factory to be back at work next week and then I'll have a new shipping date and I'll send a new update when I have that. Apparently this is delaying a lot of KS projects that didn't make the Chinese New Year deadline.
I'm using the extra time to squeeze in all the additional preorders for the first batch of games (18Chesapeake, 1817, 18MEX) submitted thus far into this first shipment. I'll redo the shipping plan on Friday so any orders placed up until Thursday February 13 will be included in the first shipment. The second batch of 2020 games (1822MX, 1849, 18NewEngland, Rolling Stock Stars) is still scheduled to ship in August and I am going to start submitting files for those this week.

campaign.story:
Every day, Donald Trump unleashes a torrent of exaggerations, insults, threats, and self-pity. What's going on inside that fevered brain? We asked the ingenious animator Bill Plympton to help us investigate.
We've been mining Internet, TV, and radio archives for juicy Trump sound bites to inspire Plympton's surreal, hand-drawn animations.
Trump Bites is the illegitimate offspring of Plympton's witty animations and Trump's witless pronouncements. 
Where We Are Now
Our first three episodes are now streaming on the New York Times. We'd like to make at least a dozen more.  
Hand-drawn animation is not cheap. Bill works with a team artists that includes a colorist, a compositor, an editor, and a sound designer -- each adding their talent and hard work to the finished product. And due to the sensitive nature of the content, our legal and insurance fees are substantial. To keep this series going, we need your help.
There are so many more Trumpisms that we're eager to spoof, and we welcome your suggestions in the comments section. Here are a a few that we are considering for future episodes:
“I would love to be a well-educated black…” Trump experiences the perks of being a black male in America.
“The medical deferment is feet…” What exactly was the problem with Trump’s feet that sidelined him during the Vietnam War?  We take you inside the exam room.
"We had the most beautiful piece of chocolate cake..." Presidents Trump and Xi frolic in a chocolate dreamscape while missiles fly to "Iraq... I mean Syria."
The Team 
Bill Plympton (animator) has made over fifty films, receiving the Palme D'Or at Cannes and two Academy Award nominations;  Billy Shebar (series creator/producer) is an Emmy-nominated writer and filmmaker, whose screenplay for Dark Matter, starring Meryl Streep, won the Alfred P. Sloan Prize at Sundance; David C. Roberts (series creator/producer) is a former US diplomat turned writer/filmmaker whose work has appeared in the New York Times and the Wall Street Journal.  Billy and David are co-founders of 110th Street Films.
Adam Rackoff (consulting producer) is a frequent Plympton collaborator and the co-founder of Cinco Dedos Peliculas with actor Matthew Modine (Full Metal Jacket, Stranger Things). Evan Shapiro (consulting producer) is an Emmy-nominated producer and former President of Pivot, IFC TV, and the Sundance Channel. Peggy Stern (consulting producer) won the Academy Award for Best Animated Short as producer of The Moon and The Son (2005).
Wendy Cong Zhao is our compositor and editor; Sandrine Plympton is our colorist; Weston Fonger is our sound designer; Miles Shebar is our creative strategist; Michael Richard Martin shot our Kickstarter video; Neil J. Rosini (Franklin, Weinrib, Rudell & Vassallo) is our attorney.
How You Can Help
It costs $20K per episode to do these right, so we're asking for $60K to do at least three more. Should we be lucky enough to exceed our goal, we'll put the money toward additional episodes. Top distribution outlets have already shown interest, so there’s a wide audience eager to see them, but we want to stay independent and true to our vision. This can only happen with your help.
We're offering some tantalizing rewards for our contributors, from Bill's original drawings and storyboards to your (animated) appearance in one of our episodes.
If you'd rather get a tax deduction, you can donate to our project via Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization.  
For anyone interested in making a major contribution, we'd love to discuss ways to recognize you in our on-screen credits. Please don’t hesitate to reach out for more details.
The Way Kickstarter Works
Kickstarter is all or nothing – so if we don’t reach our initial goal of $60,000 by midnight (EST) on July 25, we won’t get any money, and no one's credit card will be charged. Please help us out by contributing whatever you can, and sharing this project as widely as you can.  Every dollar helps, and every share helps. Thank you for your support! 
Rewards Gallery
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge is to rise above the noise of the Internet to connect with the large audience that we believe is out there for this series, and to raise the money necessary to keep it going. We have a great team, and the New York Times's enthusiasm is proof that, with proper funding, Trump Bites will snowball. 

Our biggest risk is getting sued. These short films are no-holds-barred parodies of real Trump audio. We have hired a top lawyer, Neil Rosini, who has diligently prepared for any eventuality. We have also obtained insurance to mitigate the remaining risk.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thank you to everyone who's pledged support of the SLIDE film as we wrap up our second week here on Kickstarter. We've added some NEW rewards in response to your comments during Bill's Facebook LIVE sessions.

Several potential backers asked us about Bill's animation art - so we've opened up the archives and we've made a $350 reward tier with original colored pencil art from FOUR Plympton classics - "Your Face", "How to Kiss", "25 Ways to Quit Smoking" and the "Simpsons" couch gag called "Homer's Face".

updates.update_content:
Hi all, the three episodes that you helped us make are live on our Trump Bites YouTube channel.  Please share widely, and take a second to subscribe to the channel.  Satire is a powerful weapon against demagogues.  Thanks again to everyone for helping us make Trump Bites a success.  Stay safe.
Billy, David, and Bill P.

Dear backers,
While we're still in negotiations for a web release of Trump Bites Series 2, we wanted to let you know that the three new episodes will be screened at IFC Center in New York as part of their Short Attention Span Cinema program. Each episode screens for a week before their regular features:
Fri Jun 7 – Thu Jun 13: “I alone can fix it!”

Dear backers, 
We just found out that Trump Bites is the winner of the 2019 Webby Award for best animated series. The Webbys this year had 13,000 entries from all 50 U.S. states and 70+ countries, so to be chosen is "yuge"  -- "the internet's highest honor" according to the New York Times.

campaign.story:
PRAISE “Bob"! – the fates have brought you into an encounter with J.R. “Bob” Dobbs through this instructional video barrage Kickstarter delivery device – the first step on your personal road to SLACK, an unsurpassable beatific experience.
AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM FILMMAKER ALEX COX
PLAY

Alex Cox has directed such cult classics as Repo Man and Sid & Nancy.
DID YOU US IN TEXAS MONTHLY ?!
PREVIOUSLY FORBIDDEN KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THIS FILM 
The Church of the SubGenius has been called “the most aggressively preposterous theology the world has ever known!” But what is the Church? And who is J.R. "Bob" Dobbs? And why is his name always in quotes? And for nonbelievers, why has this strangely compelling parody religion, this long-running postmodern joke, caught the attention of such pop culture icons as Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, Jon Stewart, David Letterman, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), David Byrne, Robert Crumb, Richard Linklater, Alex Cox, Ken Kesey, Frank Zappa, Jonathan Demme, and Devo’s Mark Mothersbaugh? And is it true that Tori Amos is also one of "Bob"’s chosen?  
"Bob" and the Church have caught the attention of many– include David Byrne, Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens), Tori Amos, Stephen Colbert, Robert Crumb, Mark Mothersbaugh and DEVO, Matt Groening, Margaret Moser, Rachel Maddow, Nick Offerman, and more.
ARE WE CONTROLLED BY SECRET FORCES? ARE ALIEN MONSTERS BRINGING A STARTLING NEW WORLD? DO PEOPLE THINK YOU’RE STRANGE? DO YOU? 
The Church of the SubGenius: The Early Years
“We tied together every occult, superstitious fringe belief you could think of…it was so much fun!”
– Ivan Stang, co-founder
Born into the suburban world of the 1950s, future founders of the Church of the SubGenius Reverend Ivan Stang (Douglass St. Clair Smith) and Dr. Philo Drummond (Steve Wilcox) come of age during the 1960s and 70s – a time of unprecedented social and political tumult. They experience the rise of a deafening consumer culture, the tarnishing of the "American Dream," the violence of the Vietnam War abroad, and the Kennedy assassinations and conspiracies that follow. 
As youths they revel in the delights of stable families, monster movies, Science Fiction, super-8 moviemaking, dinosaur figures, comic books, and Rock 'n' Roll. As they grow older they witness the emergence of televangelism, the Jonestown Massacre, punk culture, and Reaganomics.
Despite both growing up in Texas, it was not until the mid 70s that Stang and Drummond meet and quickly forge a friendship over a shared love of comic books, Captain Beefheart, and UFO paperbacks. One not so particular eve in 1977, while bemoaning their lack of conventional “success” for two such intelligent, well read chaps, Stang remarks, “Well, we’re not exactly geniuses.” To which Drummond replies, “yeah, we’re sub-geniuses.” 
And in that moment the Church of the SubGenius is born. It is not long after that J.R. "Bob" Dobbs reveals himself as the Church's iconic prophet and foremost patron of ineffable Slack. In fact, Stang and Drummond will later come to the realization that "Bob" has been planting evidence of his presence for them for the past twenty years!!!
THE SUBGENIUS DIASPORA
“There was that moment of realizing that this thing goes further than I ever imagined.”
– Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman)
In late 1979 Stang and Drummond, with the help of their wives, brainstorm what would become perhaps the single most significant marketing effort made at the inception of the Church of the SubGenius – the writing, design, printing, and distribution of Pamphlet #1. The doctrine of the Church quickly spreads, and the word of “Bob” and the teachings of JHVH-1 teach “time control” as a way to wrest “Slack” from the ‘Pinks’ and ‘Normals.’ The Church, it seems, has struck a nerve amidst the deadening consumer culture, the evisceration of basic social services, and the worship of wealth that occurred during the Reagan/Thatcher years.
L: An early years Devival | R: The Three Wise Guys – Ivan Stang, Dr.X and Philo Drummond – pose with a Model X Humanoid (1979)
As “Bob”’s pamphlet continues to travel the world, the emergent punk publishing scene and new wave comic writers seize on the humor and cultural critique of the Church's doctrine. In San Francisco it is fished out of a trashcan by cartoonist and artist Paul Mavrides, igniting a SubGenius cell that gives the movement some of its most enduring art and performances through LIES (Paul Mavrides), Dr. Howland Owl (Hal Robins), Puzzling Evidence (Doug Wellman), Janor Hypercleats and Pope Sternodox. 
"Bob" captures the zetigeist of the day. Cartoonist Robert Crumb reprints Pamphlet #1 in the first issue of his comic Weirdo. A few years later Simon and Schuster publishes The Book of the SubGenius.  Acclaimed film director and SubGenius Alex Cox channels Church mythology in Repo Man as the glowing, alien-owned Chevy Malibu soars high above Los Angeles with Otto (Emilio Estevez) and Miller (Tracy Walke) inside, their faces shining with Slack as Bud (Harry Dean Stanton) watches from below. 
Dr. Howl and Puzzling Evidence conduct legendary “Devivals,” radio shows (More than an Hour, Less than a Show), and introduce the word of "Bob" to Burning Man. The Stark Fist of Removal newsletter, The Hour of Slack podcast, an MTV special, and countless cassette tapes, posters, comics, videos, websites, and Facebook groups perpetuate the word of "Bob." 
By the turn of the century, publications as powerful as TIME Magazine begin to get the SubGenius joke when “Bob” is voted ‘Fraud of the Century” by readers of its online poll. In the late 90’s and early 2000’s, the “Free Party” constituents of Brighton in Great Britain voted “Bob” Dobbs as an M.P. to the House of Commons three times.
Today, “Bob”’s hucksterism and the wisdom of JHVH-1 is apparent in all fifty states and a multitude of countries across the globe!
PLAY

Another early SubGenius of Texas, David Boone (late husband of Slacking Towards Bethlehem director Sandy K. Boone), documents the rise of the SubGenius in his 1980 film, Invasion of the Aluminum People, which is lauded by Academy Award winning director Jonathan Demme. This is one of the first known recorded instances of the transmission of SLACK.
GIVE TO THIS KICKSTARTER NOW AND ACHIEVE SALVATION – OR TRIPLE YOUR MONEY BACK!!!!!!
Only with your support can our intrepid group of award-winning filmmakers dare to make this film. By giving us your hard earned cash, we can make this dream a reality, and breach all Earthly human, political, and cultural barriers with the searing nonhuman truth of the Word of "Bob," J.R. "Bob" Dobbs, that LIVING GOD WHO WALKS THIS PLANET EARTH IN HUCKSTER'S SHOES. 
To date, we’ve travelled over 8,000 miles and interviewed 15 SubGenius in four cities, sharing the so-called "reality" that SubGenii are forced to share with humans. We’ve only just begun to uncover many of the SubGenius’ most guarded secrets. The SubGenii are finally willing to go public and tell the TRUTH. 
This is YOUR chance to get in on the ground floor of a huge, globally important cult. You will then attract all the $$$, pleasure spacecraft, and SHEER POWER OVER OTHERS that go with high-ranking support of the Church and this documentary! 
But most important, you can smite your enemies, achieve TIME CONTROL and attain SLACK.
REMEMBERING SAINT MARGARET
Since we began production on our film, a beloved avatar of the early SubGenius tribe, Margaret Moser, passed away on August 25 of this year. One of the nation’s top music journalists and music scene nurturers, Reverend Reverend Doctor Doctor Archdoctor Saint Margaret Moser even had a photo of J.R. “Bob” Dobbs on her Austin Chronicle business card. She said it helped her connect with her interview subjects, many of whom were already members of the Church themselves.
PLAY

In her interview with us, she spoke about the pleasure, “the great release, to have all this nutty stuff in your head and find like minded people to express it with.” But most notably she sang a song written by her own hand, "Oh, Life's a Bowl of Cherries with "Bob" Dobbs." Saint Moser's life epitomized the way that membership in the Church accelerated the discovery of true friendships, experimentations, creative collisions, and rebellion through art, music, and comedy against dehumanization in any form.
WHY THIS FILM? 
Why not this film? Pull the wool over your own eyes and help us make a movie! The Church of the SubGenius is the underground movement that has galvanized the imaginative, the artistic, the nerdy, even the deranged – to examine the simmering dystopia in their culture, and do absolutely nothing about it... except, maybe, poke fun at it all. The Church of the SubGenius is taking over the universe. The sooner you learn about it, the better off you’ll be. 
PLAY

Now more than ever we feel that the story of the Church of the SubGenius needs to be told. There's a core of ideas within the SubGenius ethos – of fighting oppression with humor, community and creativity, of using absurdity as a nonviolent weapon, giving time, permission and priority to expression, creation, and zaniness with friends –  that we think has great value we believe these ideas are necessary in today's world and that our film about the SubGenius is the perfect way to invoke them.
Amongst all the spaceships, frop, pipes, eye-bludgeoning graphics, bulldada, yeti ancestors, (and yes, ‘macho spoutings’), we hope you will fund this film so you can join our merry band of pranksters on the culture-jam of the century! It’s going to be a lot of fun!!!
No stranger to hiding in plain sight – "Bob" is everywhere, IF you know to look for him!
So please, give to our film, get our cool merch, show up at screenings, and talk to us in every way possible. We will have our third nostril open at all times.
And remember, as one famous SubGenius said, “since the main message is ‘think for yourself,’ the last thing you should be doing is believing all we’re telling you. We make it up as we go along.”
Ivan Stang hosts the 999 Club (1981)
WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?
With this funding, we can complete the remaining interviews, edit the film, animate key sequences, and all other post-production work necessary to bring this ridiculous story to the masses.
A behind the scenes look at our film production. Note that "Bob" is never too far from where we are. (L: Image courtesy of Paul Mavrides | R: Image courtesy of Kelly Cash)
HOW YOU CAN HELP
A Boy's Guide - fig. 13013
Let ‘Bob’ into your savings. 
Kickstarter is ALL-OR-NOTHING – If we don’t meet our $199,999.99 goal, we won’t receive ANY of the funding. Don't let The Conspiracy win!  We need to get this story out into the world before it all comes to an end.
Tomorrow is obsolete. 
SHUT UP PINK BOY AND PLEDGE EARLY! – Be the ultimate slacker and slack off on slacking. The earlier you pledge, the more likely others are to contribute.
Instant answers to everything!
Don’t wallow in submission. Reveal the Church of the SubGenius Documentary to your slackless friends through social media, and watch as their Pink minds become wonderful, abnormal soups of mush. Just how we like it.
Blasted by knowledge
SHUT UP OR STAND UP BY SHARING OUR FILM ON SOCIAL MEDIA!  – How can you direct your friends to our Kickstarter? Write your own post linking our Kickstarter at bit.ly/SlackOn, or, for the slack-est among you use one of our pre-written posts below –
Twitter: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? Don't wallow in submission any longer! bit.ly/SlackOn
Facebook: Praise "Bob"! I have the SLACK it takes to give all my money to this new film. Do YOU? The Church of the SubGenius is the subject of a new documentary I am supporting – check it out! But beware, you might pull the wool over your own eyes in the process. bit.ly/SlackOn
THE REWARDS
To THANK YOU for backing our documentary we have a great selection of classic favorites -- and more. But this campaign also offers some extremely unique items. So dive in. Look around. Scroll your way to bliss!
Partnering with Paul Mavrides, we will have an original film poster by one of the great artists and cartoonists living today. NO KIDDING! This is going to be something you don’t want to miss. And we also already received --- shhhhhhh! – some amazing, crazy, stuff – memorabilia, illustrations, artwork -- from the archives of some celebrity and anonymous SubGenius alike. Stay tuned. This is the stuff that will never, ever make its way to Ebay.
*Final Reward designs may vary.

Items marked as “limited” are truly one of a kind items created specifically for this campaign as a unique offering to thank you for becoming part of the team. From a “Bob” toaster that will help you begin your day with edible Slack to real life film credits in our finished film, we hope you embrace “Bob”’s rule of thumb that “too much is always better than not enough.
Claim 'em quick! Limited quantities available.
PAUL MAVRIDES ORIGINAL ART
We know what you're thinking. FINE ARTS? SUBGENIUS? How much frop are you smoking? Paul Mavrides is one of the originators and sustainers of the SubGenius aesthetic, and he is also a major artist whose work shows at Fine Art galleries and whose graphic design is sought after by companies like Apple. Writing about Paul for a recent show at the Steven Wolfe Fine Arts Gallery in San Francisco, art critic Mark Van Proyers said that SubGenius output is a key influence "on much of the art production of the 1990s... and the mythomaniacal clip-art orgies that Mavrides concocted for several of the highly entertaining “SubGenious” books still seem to sustain a spot-on freshness…."
NEW REWARDS GENEROUSLY DONATED BY LOUIS BLACK, FROM HIS PERSONAL COLLECTION
Louis Black is the co-founder of the Austin Chronicle and co-founder of the South By Southwest Music Festival and Conference (SXSW).
ANNOUNCING NEW REWARDS FROM COMIC BOOK ARTIST CULLY HAMNER. AND WE'RE KINDA GEEKING OUT OVER IT!
Cully Hamner is an American comic book artist, known for his work on such books as Green Lantern: Mosaic, Blue Beetle, Black Lightning: Year One, and Detective Comics.
MORE COOL CRAP FROM SubGenius DR. PHILO DRUMMOND! Signed by KRK RYDEN
KRK Ryden is an artist, musician, SubGenii and Bay Area native. His surrealistic art style is reflective of his taste in cartoons and pulp art and his work is described as "colorful and visually appealing reflections on discarded icons."
ABOUT THE FILMMAKERS 
SANDY K BOONE | Director / Producer
Sandy K. Boone began making films in Austin in the 1980s with her late husband, filmmaker David Boone, whose Texas cult classic Invasion of the Aluminum People was presented by director Jonathan Demme at the Collective for Living Cinema in 1981 in New York. Three decades later, Boone and Black produced a restoration of the film as part of Jonathan Demme: Made in Texas – Six Films From Austin, which premiered at SXSW in 2015. At that screening, Richard Linklater told how seeing Invasion, and another of the MIT films at an art gallery screening in Houston inspired him to move to Austin.
LOUIS BLACK | Executive Producer 
Louis Black co-founded The Austin Chronicle, where he was editor for more than three decades, SXSW, where he is a director, and was a founding Board Member of the Austin Film Society. He has written extensively on film, music and politics. Executive producer of Be Here to Love Me, A Film About Townes Van Zandt, he was a producer on the Peabody Award Winning The Order of Myths. Working with Mark Rance he produced a reissue of Eagle Pennell's The Whole Shootin' Match.
Sandy K Boone and Louis Black, of Black and Boone Productions.
BLACK AND BOONE now closely collaborate on all projects. They were deeply involved in crafting, structuring and shaping the documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny, which premiered at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival and was the initial screening of PBS's American Masters 2017 Fall season. They worked as Executive Producers on Keith Maitland's critically acclaimed Tower and Karen Skloss' The Honor Farm, which premiered at SXSW. They are executive producers on The Newspaperman and Road Angel, both still in production. Blaze, written and directed by Ethan Hawke, on which they worked, is scheduled for a 2018 release. Their next project to be released is Eggshells, a reissue of Tobe Hooper’s first film from 1969.
MICHELLE RANDOLPH FAIRES | Producer
Michelle Randolph Faires began her career in independent film by supporting area film-related non-profit organizations before moving into production. She worked with Austin Film Festival as the Festival & Conference Hospitality Coordinator for two years before joining the staff full-time as the Outreach and Community Coordinator. Additionally, she supported aGLIFF, as the Volunteer Coordinator and Festival Manager, later serving a full three year term on the Board of Directors. After moving into the production world, she produced her first short, followed by a feature length documentary on the legendary Broken Spoke dancehall, Honky Tonk Heaven. The film premiered at SXSW 2016 and earned an Audience Award. Michelle has been a part of the funding and producing teams for film projects The Newspaperman, Leslie and Monkey Business: The Adventures of Curious George's Creators, as well as PBS-KLRU series Standup Empire, a series showcasing the expansive comedy scene in Austin, Texas.
LAUREN SANDERS | Editor 
Lauren Sanders is an editor and post-production supervisor with experience on a wide range of commercial and film projects. After working as senior editor at Arts+Labor for 6 years, she collaborated extensively with clients like GSD&M and C3. Her most recent film credits include post-supervisor on 2017's comedy, Ripped, co-writer and editor on the documentary The Jones Family Will Make a Way, and assistant editor and co-composer on Clay Liford's Slash. She also is credited as post-production supervisor and assistant editor on Kat Candler’s Hellion, an official selection of both the Sundance and SXSW film festivals. Lauren is a graduate of the Radio-Television-Film program at the University of Texas at Austin.
DAVID LAYTON | Director of Photography
David Layton is an Austin-based filmmaker with a passion for cinematography and documentary film. He began his career as a newspaper reporter, but honed his technical skills working in the camera department on notable documentary features such as The Unforeseen, Be Here to Love Me, The Devil and Daniel Johnston, You’re Gonna Miss Me, Nuclear Family, Troop 1500, and Letter From Waco. He was cinematographer on two recent PBS documentaries, By the River of Babylon: An Elegy for South Louisiana and Through the Repellant Fence: A Land Art Film. Most recently, David shot the feature documentary Richard Linklater – dream is destiny and is directing/producing The Newspaperman about legendary Philadelphia Inquirer editor Gene Roberts.
IVAN STANG | Consultant
Ivan Stang is a writer, filmmaker, radio broadcaster/personality, as well as one of the founders of the Church of the SubGenius. As a filmmaker, Stang has done animation work and editing for films such as Arise!: The SubGenius Video, a “spoof” documentary for the Church of the SubGenius, and animation work for MTV and music video shorts. He is most notable for writing The Book of the SubGenius, and other SubGenius literature. Stang hosts the hour-long radio broadcast "The Hour of Slack," produced partially by WCSB at Cleveland State University and syndicated across North America. He remains an active SubGenii, continuing his work with the Church and appearing at X-Day, the SubGenius celebration held every year in Ohio, where Stang resides.
A POEM WRITTEN BY THE FILMMAKERS

updates.update_userinfo: SubGenius Doc Picked Up for Distribution!!
updates.update_content:
Greeting, SubGenii – 
Did you miss us?!?!
"Bob" works in mysterious ways, and at long last we can reveal all that has been going on behind the scenes of our film. After spending the better part of 2018 interviewing, editing, color-correcting, sound-mixing, and festival submitting, we are proud and excited to announce that –
Greetings Friends! Welcome to 2018!

THANK YOU!!!!! WE DID IT!!!!!! and now...........THE END IS JUST THE BEGINNING AND PRAISE "BOB"
YOU BEAUTIFUL DONORS YOU! BECAUSE OF YOU, WE DID IT!!!!! WE raised $206,891 WITH 1,257 BACKERS JOINING US IN THIS SLACK REVOLUTION!
We want to take you with us!! The SubGenii tribe is growing and trust us, we are a lot more fun when the Conspiracy isn’t making us madly scrounge for dollars.  and let “Bob” show you We are taking all our toys, (and we have even better ones there), all our new friends, and continuing on our magic pleasurecraft ride through the world of the SubGenius, past and future. We’ll keep you posted on our progress.

comments.content: * We're a good 15 years past the era of standard definition video, so I assumed we'd get the option to select a high definition disc when it came time to making the discs. Nope - strictly DVD. Again, my fault for not checking.

Out of nowhere, with zero notice via Kickstarter or email, the DVD of the doc arrived today, along with sundry stickers and buttons. Communication is still garbage, but at least this saga is more or less over for me and I can forget this KS ever existed.
Come on, we want a link where us in the UK/Europe can view/download our copy.
Hey there, glad the movie’s out, would still appreciate that poster though, haven’t gotten replies to messages.
It's easy to treat little people well. Just tell them what's going on. Maybe there's a good reason why you couldn't get this out sooner. But we were never told one, and now we don't care.
In Switzerland i cannot even get it from Vimeo because it's "not available in your region".
Yep. US and Canada only. I feel bad for people outside North America.
The problem was solved in very short time. The download is now possible outside of North America.
I still hate you.

Woah, I was a bit over the top! The 'frop talkin' as they say. But I will end with this: If someone gave me money for a project I'd be sure to shovel their snow every Christmas. What a bunch of self-entitled snots.

Really, $45 pledged three years ago, and that's it? I don't even get to watch a stream, I have to shell out another $10 on Amazon to RENT it? Yeah, I'm feeling a total fricking lack of slack right about now, you crooks. This is just WRONG.
And fat, too!

And to add: people like Sand Infested Platoon are why no one will contribute to a kickstarter ever again. I sure won't. Pat yourself on the back, bitch. You fucked over fellow artists so you could stay in fancy hotels and eat caviar for a movie that could have been made for 40 easy. You are an ugly person!

What a bunch of scam artists! That's directed to Sandy Boones Farm Strawberry Hill Whine, not Stang or the Church (G*d Bless, Them). I don't really care about the money I contributed. I did it to give Stang his proper due. Sandy: it will be a real trip if we ever cross paths! Are you ready for that?

campaign.story:
Welcome!  And thank you for checking out my project.  The idea behind this project is a simple one: with so many $1 "Thank You" pledge levels out there I thought "why not get a GAME for $1!" 
And not just some Print-n-Play version of a game, but a REAL game with components and everything.  
Challenge accepted!
So what game should I make?  What could I design for $1 that would speak to the millions of Kickstarter backers that could equal the value of receiving a heartfelt (canned) "Thank You" with their $1 pledge?  And then it hit me!
WHAT ABOUT A $1 GAME THAT THEMATICALLY APPROXIMATES THE ACTIONS AND FEELINGS OF PLEDGING $1 AND GETTING A "THANK YOU" E-MAIL!!??  
And alas...
Why just get a "Thank You," when you can get a GAME?
...was born!
In mere hours I had completed every aspect along the path to creating a board game: brainstorming, sketching, designing, prototyping, looking up Rotten Tomatoes reviews on upcoming movies, testing, game-balancing, more testing, drinking a Coke Zero or two and finally the finalization of the final finished product:
DELUXE version shown with PRACTICALLY REAL, BUT NOT ACTUALLY REAL $1 Pledge component!
So now there's naught left to do but print it, pack it and send it out to any and all of you who truly desire to have a board game that represents that feeling you get when you spend $1 to back a project at the "Thank You" level.  (Scroll down for gameplay video)
This project only needs TEN(10) $1 backers to be successful.
So please, won't you consider being one of those ten people? 
You WON'T get my thanks.  You WILL get A GAME!
$1 Pledge level can go ANYWHERE!!!!
STRETCH GOALS!!
Just like any great Kickstarter project, The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game has several stretch goals that will be unlocked should we reach total pledge levels above and beyond the $10 project funding level!
RULES REFERENCE ON THE BOARD! UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $25
Convenient, no??
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will include a handy rules reference guide printed right on the board!  You wan't convenience?  You GOT it!
C-C-C-CARDSTOCK!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $50
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game game boards will be printed on quality card stock ensuring a longer-lasting product that you'll be able to enjoy again and again and again!
SOLO VARIANT!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $75
The game is designed with a minimum player count of 2, but at this level ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with solo rules!  Now you can play with yourself!
HATE MESSAGE CARD!  UNLOCKED!!Unlocked at $100
No, no... They make a valid point...
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will include an additional component: the "I pledged $1 just so that I could tell the designers how much I hate their stupid campaign" message card!
This component comes with optional advanced rules that allow you to reclaim your $1 pledge immediately after playing the Hate Message Card!  Just like the real thing!  Amazing!
ADDITIONAL "THANK YOU" CARDS!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $150
Variety is the spice of life!
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will include TWO (2) additional "Thank You" message cards, each with a unique message!  That's TRIPLE the replay value!
This component will unlock optional rules that show you how to add these cards to the base game so that you'll never know exactly which Thank You note you'll get!  Random?  Yes!
IT'S ALL SO SHINY!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $200
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game Thank You Cards will be printed on high-quality, high-gloss card stock so that each time you draw your Thank You note, you can imagine the shiny card is like a shiny new computer...
USE MORE INK!  UNLOCKED!!Unlocked at $250
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board game will be printed using the "High Quality" setting on my printer, instead of just the "Standard" print setting. 
PRINT-N-PLAY MESSAGE CARD! UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $300
Ok, so SOMETIMES you can get a Print-n-Play of a game for $1.  Well, when this stretch goal is unlocked:
I wonder if that URL would really work?
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with a "Print-N-Play" message card! 
This component will come with optional rules that allow you to use this card INSTEAD of the standard Thank You message card.  Just like in real life, this card will come complete with a URL and special access code so that you can get a PnP version of the game!  Because who wouldn't want 14 copies of this game?
(Actual card really WILL have a PnP access site and code...)
CREDIT CARD COMPONENT!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $400
Design not final. This is just a pic I found with Google.
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with an alternate currency to use to pay your $1 pledge in the shape and size of a piece of plastic that has lots of numbers and letters on it!
IT'S 4:20 YO! ALTERNATE GAME RULES!  UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $420
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with a completely alternate game mode rule set that describes how to use your $1 bill component for... I'll say alternative purposes of the "questionably legal in most states" variety... 
PERSONALIZED CREDIT CARD COMPONENT! RE-UNLOCKED!!
Unlocked at $450
I'm sorry, but your account is past due...
ALL Credit Card components will be personalized!  That's right, it'll have YOUR name on it!  And just like the REAL thing, thanks to all the Kickstarter games you're buying, it will barely have any credit left on it!
ALTERNATE GAME BOARD ART!  --LOCKED!!
Unlocked at $500
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with a DOUBLE-SIDED game board with ENTIRELY different art!  
FIRST PLAYER MARKER!  --LOCKED!!
Unlocked at $550
The gaming community is amazing and it was brought to my attention that while the gameplay video was very clear about the rules, it could become quite confusing to determine who's turn it's supposed to be.  So when this stretch goal is unlocked:
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with a 1st player marker.  Exactly what that marker's design will be is currently under consideration, but I will be keeping resin in mind as the material choice for the final product!
"NO REWARD" RULE SET!  --LOCKED!!
Unlocked at $600
ALL copies of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will include an alternate rule set in which you can experience true altruism by pledging $1 for NO reward whatsoever -- not even a Thank You!
LEGACY MODE!!  --LOCKED!!
Unlocked at $1000
What???  That's right!  At this level EVERY copy of The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will come with LEGACY rules so that when you play the game, the "Designer" player gets to KEEP your $1 pledge, and the "Backer" player gets to KEEP the Thank you!  
Then both players can do whatever they want with them!  Frame them, trash them, spend them (if you're the Designer), trade them... It's your choice!  But you can never use those components in The Obligatory $1 Level Board Game again... because the rules will say so.
MORE STRETCH GOALS! --LOCKED!!
Unlocked at $601
Right, so by some ridiculous reason this project hits this point, I'll work up some new stretch goals and add them.
SECRET STRETCH GOALS!!
There's no word on these stretch goals!  They're secret/surprise stretch goals that will be unlocked at certain campaign milestones!
SECRET #1: TWO DAY REMINDER STAR COMPONENT!
Unlocked at 100 backers
Every copy of the Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game will now come with the Two Day reminder component.
This stretch goal unlocks optional rules that allow you delay your $1 pledge until 2 days prior to the campaign end!  This is an excellent rule change for those of you who like your games to be longer (like Arkham Horror or Munchkin when you're in an infinity loop...).
GAME PLAY VIDEO!
Interested in seeing The Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Game in action?  Well watch this in-depth video!
If for some reason you can't see the video here, use this link:
https://youtu.be/nY_UxOz66q8

updates.update_userinfo: A visit from gaming's Dark Dimension
updates.update_content:
So, let's start with the GOOD news - printing has begun on game boards.  They take a lot more ink than I'd anticipated so I'll have to go octopus and squid hunting some more but the job's begun nonetheless.
Now, here's the BAD news:  The boards print three to a sheet, so they need to be cut.  Well... I got a really nasty paper cut whilst working through that process.
"That's it!?" you exclaim.  "That's the bad news?" you ask.  Alas, you don't know what happened NEXT...

Hello dear backers!  
Five months.  Five months?   It's been five months since my last update and for that...  Well I'd like to say I'm sorry but I'm really kind of not and I'll tell you why:  Well, the black ink wasn't too tough, but dammit if the world isn't terribly stingy on cyan, yellow and magenta colored octopuses.  And once I found them it's a matter of frightening them so that they release their ink.  Obviously the yellow ones scared pretty easily, but the magenta ones in particular were almost as hard to startle as those bushy-helmeted guard fellows outside of Buckingham Palace.  And they bite.  The octopuses, not the guards.

Ok, it's on me for not keeping you abreast of all that's going on.  Giving me a $1 certainly warrants your getting updates on every aspect of my life and for this I sincerely apologize.
First things first:  your money is NOT lost.  You are NOT forgotten!  My promise to deliver you an outstanding game for $1 is STILL is full effect!
In all seriousness for just a moment:  I'm EXTRAORDINARILY grateful the life events that have transpired for me haven't happened with a significant investment on your part.

Hello backers!  
I have just returned from an extended medical leave.  No, seriously.  Had some heart trouble that needed attending to.
It's been too long since I've updated you (comically or otherwise).
This is just a quick note to let you all know I'm still here, I have NOT run away with your money and you WILL get your game.

As it turns out, producing this game is going to cost me money.  At least a few bucks, but I'm willing to take that hit to my wallet for the sake of our esteemed hobby.
Things were well in my favor when we had those two $100 backers and the one $25 dollar backer, but as you know, at the last minute, they flew the coup which killed several stretch goals and left us all with our junk in our hands.  Lord if you could have seen the email I got from absolutely inconsolable backers who were upset that they weren't going to get that credit card component...

I'm starting to feel the pressure as this project falls further and further behind.
I believe we can get back on track so long as I'm able to get a little help from you, my dear and loyal followers.
My current issue is a lack of viable component materials.  Does anyone know where I can find "paper?"

Yes indeed it's been some time since I've posted an update, and yes I see your concerned comments that I've stolen your cheap beer money and run to the hills with it.
This couldn't be further from the truth.  I DID think long and hard about running into the hills with your money, but in the end I thought, "eh, too much physical effort" so I decided to carry on with the game as promised.  To that end, here's the story on the debacle that has been trying to procure fresh, crisp, "fake" (totally real) $1 bills for you Deluxe and above backers.

So, as promised, I intend to share with you every step in the process of developing your Obligatory $1 Pledge Level Board Games.
As such, early next week, I should have a "Progress Matrix" completed that will show all the steps necessary to produce and ship your games as well as how far along within each step we are.
So I guess THIS step is to tell you about a forthcoming step in which I complete the step that will display the steps necessary to reach the final step of this game's production and delivery.

campaign.story:
And be sure to come and take a look at our website too!
Hello! We’re Alex and Jonny, the co-founders of One Third Stories. We're on a mission to inspire more children to love and learn foreign languages. But we can't do that without your help.
We want to make learning a language as simple as reading a story. That means creating a beautiful hardback book that starts in English and ends in a different language by gradually introducing foreign words in easy-to-understand contexts. 
A mock-up of the book featuring Hannah Hutchings' incredible artwork
You can make that dream a reality by pledging your support. There's a whole load of rewards you can get in return, from a copy of the finished book to voting on your favourite story ideas and helping to shape what we're creating. Even just taking a moment to tell your friends about the campaign would be amazing!
It's no secret that languages are pretty amazing. They can improve our minds, give us better career prospects, and help us see the world. Imagine getting all those benefits in childhood!
But lots of kids just aren’t getting a good start when it comes to learning languages. Remember the verb tables, the textbooks stuffed full of grammar and the ‘label everything in your pencil case’ activities? They're still out there and they're still making kids dread their French lessons.
The trouble is that lots of our fantastic teachers are expected to teach foreign languages when they haven’t been trained to do so. Some parents try and help out at home but that can be tricky because they don't speak another language themselves.
The result of all this is that 58% of adults in the UK regret not learning another language when they were younger. That number is only set to get bigger as a whole generation miss out on the gift of another language.
We want to change all of this by combining language education with entertainment. That's why we're making a beautiful hardback book for kids, illustrated by the incredibly talented Hannah Hutchings.
It's designed to help parents and teachers who don't speak another language themselves support their children. It also makes learning a language so enjoyable that the kids will be excited to learn more!
A mock-up of the book featuring Hannah Hutchings' incredible artwork
Initially, we were only planning to make three versions of the book; one to teach French, one for Spanish, and one for Italian. Thanks to the support of the Goethe-Instiut, the organisation responsible for promoting the German culture and language worldwide, we're delighted to announce that we're going to be making a German version too! If you're interested in purchasing this version, just pledge at the reward tier you fancy and we'll send you a survey at the end of the campaign asking which language version you'd like.
We're also creating an accompanying app - a digital version of the story with narration from a native speaker of each language.
The story itself is all about a little girl who goes outside in a storm to rescue a cat and has all of her words blown away. On her adventure to get them all back, she learns all sorts of new words in a different language.
We know children are going to love this story because over 1500 of them have helped to write it! We took their brilliant ideas and turned them into characters in the book.
Throughout the story, we use The Clockwork Methodology®, which we created to make learning a language as easy and enjoyable as possible for kids. Here's how it works...
The Clockwork Methodology® works because it helps children learn a new language in the same way that they expand their vocabulary in their native tongue.
Mixing languages like this might seem strange, but it's not uncommon amongst bilingual people. It's called code switching and studies have shown that exposing children to it can actually have cognitive benefits as they develop strategies to process all that input. 
We’re Alex and Jonny, the co-founders of One Third Stories. We’ve been friends for over 8 years now, and a big chunk of that time has been spent trying to revolutionise the way children learn languages.
That journey started when we were still at school. We set up a Young Enterprise company with some other friends and made a book about a penguin and a little girl who travelled the world learning languages. Parents and kids loved it but we stopped to focus on our A-levels.
Fast-forward a few years, and Alex was busy learning his fourth language, whilst Jonny was studying how children acquire languages at university. It suddenly occurred to us that we had the skills to reinvent our project with The Clockwork Methodology® and make a brand new story!
Yup. That's Alex in the penguin suit.
Why is this project so important to us? Because languages are absolutely amazing and all children deserve the chance to learn them! Alex found this out first hand growing up bilingual in Paraguay. Languages have given him the chance to see the world, make friends all over the place, and resulted in some really exciting career opportunities. 
For Jonny, it was a bit different. Neither of his parents could speak another language and he hated the lessons at school. It was only when he grew up and got the chance to travel that he felt he’d missed out on all the benefits of languages and started learning French again.
One picture that says everything you need to know about Alex and Jonny's differing attitudes to language learning
We’re on Kickstarter because we want to make sure that children get a great start in language learning so that they don’t end up regretting missed opportunities like Jonny does. We want them to grow up learning about other cultures and making international friends and discovering all the other benefits that a second (or third or fourth or even fifth!) language can bring.  
Here are a few of the things we're offering as rewards to people who pledge their support in this Kickstarter campaign. Don't forget to keep an eye out for EARLY BIRD OFFERS to get a great discount on the book!
 Here's an example of the sort of thing you can expect from one of our puppet shows...
 ...and a sneak peak at some of the postcards on offer...
"Mini me loves this book and he didn’t even notice that I was saying some words in Spanish. It’s definitely a fun and easy way to introduce a new language." 
Lyndsey Edwards - parent, blogger & home educator 
"This is such a fab idea, and feels like a very natural way of learning new vocabulary...It's so much better than endlessly reciting the same thing over and over again, the way so many forays into language learning begin."

"As the story went on and more Spanish words crept in he did question it but was still able to follow what was happening in the story. He’s been repeating his new Spanish words ever since!"

Here's a quick look at how we'll be spending the money and our timeline for completing the project.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve been working towards this project for over a year and have done everything possible to minimise the risks involved. 

- We’ve found a printer who will produce the books to a high standard and make sure they get delivered all over the world promptly. 

- We’ve given ourselves plenty of time to send out the books and fulfil the other rewards by Christmas. 

- We’re working with Hannah Hutchings, a ridiculously talented illustrator with heaps of experience, so we know the book is going to look amazing.

- We’re getting advice from senior people in the publishing industry to make sure we can tackle any issues before they even arise. 

- We’re using a special piece of software for the app design which allows us to produce it much faster than a normal app.

Thank you so much for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Thank you Kickstarter backers! You have made this dream a reality, and we are eternally grateful!
If you are discovering Civicus Dice after the campaign has ended, please visit our website for details about the retail release of the game!
Civicus Dice Game is a thirty minute, civilization themed, strategic, area control game of thoughtful settlement placement, and fateful dice rolls. Players take turns placing and developing settlements in order to claim a variety of domains and their respective advantages. In order to secure victory, the players must cultivate a well balanced nation. One rich in technology, settlements & farms, markets & exotics, as well as, temples & sacred sites.
In this 2 -4 player game (4 with Tribe IV tier), the players find themselves submerged in a visually stunning, abstract world of epic high fantasy; a vast and expansive world, set at the very dawn of civilization.
As newly ascribed tribal leaders, the players are challenged with all of the difficulties which burden any great leader --Where to call home...who to conquer...when to make peace...
Here's a series of videos about Mark's experiences with the demo game:

"Just played the PNP demo with my daughter. We LOVED it! Just upped my pledge to the $25 for the game. Very nice game!"

"Thanks again. My friends and I had a great time playing Civicus. It was fun, interesting, and engaging. I thought the game did a nice job of incorporating a civ-builder theme into a microgame. Although the game featured a high degree of randomness due to the dice rolling mechanic, I never felt as if I was lacking options on my turn. This was due primarily to the technology advancement, which was my favorite part of Civicus. I look forward to introducing this game to my local board gaming group."
-Chris                                                                                                          _________________________________________________________
"An innovative little game, with a  Catan-esque matrix, chess like area control mechanic, and a unique scoring system! Tightly designed game, well done."
-Jonathan                                                                                                     _________________________________________________________ 
"I've had the pleasure of getting to play test a couple of the games in the Civicus series. I've yet to be let down.   
I was introduced to the series via the traditional sized board game [Civicus: Origin Myth]. Upon my first play through I was blown away.    
Will showed me the smaller dice game shortly after. I was initially taken back. Bigger is better, right? I was mistaken. I now understand why he saved Civicus Dice Game for last.
You will not find a game with more value per square inch than this one. It retains many of the mechanics that make the larger game great: empire building, competition for the resources necessary to fuel your empire, the chess-like strategy, the element of choosing whether your empires grow side by side in relative harmony, or whether you will plot and scheme your way to total dominance.
As a bonus, it adds a Yahtzee-like dice element, that in one roll can force you to question even the most well laid plans, and quickly adapt to the present situation.
The best part is that you can carry a game with all the things that make big games great, in your pocket. No lugging out a big box, setting up a big board, etc.
Play it in the car on a road trip, on a lunch break, outdoors...anywhere.
Most travel sized games are dumbed down, shadows of their original selves. This game is the exception.
I highly recommend it, and can't wait to get my hands on a copy of my own!

Risks and challenges
As with any great endeavor, many challenges will present themselves. In order to mitigate these challenges, we have spent the last two years studying the methods of those who have walked the path before us. This has proven invaluable!

Specifically, we anticipate that fulfillment will present many logistical challenges. To counter this, we will be calling upon the knowledge of a few of our dearest mentors. 
First, we will be consulting with a long time family friend, who has been manufacturing fishing lures since the late seventies. His expertise and specialized knowledge has, and will continue to strengthen our ability to overcome any manufacturing/fulfillment challenges that may come up along the way (thank you John!).

Second, we have a retired, ex-marketing representative (for a major beverage company), and successful entrepreneur friend who has proven an invaluable source of marketing knowledge (thanks Craig!).

Third, we have been tapping into the game industry knowledge of Marcelo Figueroa (Golden Distribution), since 2009, when we first attended GAMA trade show! Marcelo is a wealth of game industry knowledge--check out his video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZF6YiB3pvbo (Thank you Marcelo!)

Collectively, we have more than 100 years of experience to draw upon in order to make this happen in a streamlined, and efficient manner. We are confident that our abilities far out weigh our challenges!

campaign.story:
Please visit http://modernevil.com/teratozoic after the Kickstarter campaign has ended to get the most up-to-date information about the game, including the most recent version of the Print-and-Play.
The nations of mankind created horrifying new weapons to wage war with one another—genetically engineered monsters whose traits could be altered and combined to overcome any opponent. Unfortunately, humanity was no match for its own creations and armies of terrifying monsters were soon out of control in their destruction of civilization. In their final global nuclear strike, humanity accomplished only two things: They wiped themselves out, and they created a highly mutagenic environment where the monsters could thrive.
This is the world at the start of a game of Teratozoic. (From greek: terato-, of or relating to monsters, -zoic, of a (specified) era, or having a (specified) animal mode of existence.) Each player has their own deck of monster parts (their Gene Pool), and will attempt to make the best of the mutations they draw from a common deck to come out on top in the battle for survival. At first your monsters will be more random mutation than representative of a stable gene pool (players will draw most of the cards for each hand from the common deck), but by the time you reach the Teratozoic Era your monsters will be built entirely from the best traits you retained in each generation. The dominant species in this new era (the final winner of the game) will be the one with the most robust gene pool—the player who can create the biggest, most impressive monsters at the end of the Teratozoic Era.
Game contents:
7 Era cards
96 Monster-part cards, each with a unique illustration:
Starting monsters – 36 cards
Basic cards – 36 cards
Advanced cards – 24 cards
6 Reference cards (player aids)
A rule book
Each player starts with a deck of 6 cards, their 'Gene Pool', which they will gradually expand and improve over the course of the game. Each generation (one round of play), every player will draw cards in part from a deck of 'Random Mutations' (a common deck) and in part from their own deck; at the beginning of the game each hand is mostly random, but as play progresses the randomness is reduced until during the last 'Era' of play all cards are drawn from players' Gene Pools. 
After declaring whether they're playing all (or only some) of their cards, all players build monsters from their cards at the same time. Whoever's monsters score the highest 'dominates the generation' and they get both to gain more cards than the other players and to pick from among all played cards while other players may only choose cards which came from their own hands.
At the end of the game, all players will assemble their entire Gene Pool into up to three of the largest single-color monsters (with no loose ends) they're able (one of each color: orange, purple, & green) and the player who uses the most cards in their monsters is the winner. This means that winning the game depends not just on winning as many hands as possible (requiring the highest-scoring cards and rewarding the highest number of cards), but also paying enough attention to the cards gained (especially in lost generations) to ensure the right number of connections of the right colors end up in a player's Gene Pool.
With no discrete currency, plenty of player interaction & simultaneous play, plus the fun of putting together whimsical monsters every turn, Teratozoic is unlike any deck-building game you've seen before—and it's light enough that it could be used as a gateway game or enjoyed by younger players.
Download the rules (PDF) – This is the Preview version (v0.9.0) of the rules included in the Print-and-Play edition of Teratozoic. (The full PnP PDF is available below.) After the project is funded, I am planning to have the physical versions of the game include a 3.5x5" rule book containing the same information, but laid out to fit that format. (I've been working on updating and revising the PDFs of the Preview Edition of the 3.5x5" rule book (updated to v0.9.5 on 8/9, now includes cover w/interior)—I welcome any feedback that can continue improve the clarity of the final rule book, from rearranging sections (which may not be possible, due to printing constraints) to simple re-writing; this is my first game-rule-book of this size & scope, and I appreciate the help.)
How-To-Play Video – Many people will have an easier time understanding the basic flow of the game by seeing it played than they would by reading the rules, so I've put together a rough video (only about 8 minutes long!) which shows and explains the basics of an entire game of Teratozoic:
 Get the Game:
This is the main point of the project, the tier that gets you a copy of the game. If you aren't interested in designing custom cards or having your favorite monster painted, pledge $20. There is no discount for ordering multiple copies available, and won't be unless we reach a significant production volume.
I also have a few copies of the Preview Version of Teratozoic left over, which I'll be able to ship out immediately after funding clears Amazon. I produced these with the same printers/suppliers I'll be using for between about 50 and 1,000 copies of Teratozoic, so they are substantially identical to the final game. These are the same copies I've been sending to reviewers and using to preview the game at cons and local game stores, and are what you see in all the photos and videos on this page. You might pledge at this level because you want to support the project more but can't afford $99+, or because you want to start playing as soon as possible.

If you want to help get Teratozoic published, but aren't sure the game is for you (or if you can't justify the international shipping surcharges for a light card game), you can pledge at these levels and earn my gratitude, or just to join the conversation and get your foot in the door so you can decide later whether to increase your pledge.

I've seen a lot of projects in the Tabletop Games category with stretch goals which improve the quality of components, but Teratozoic will not be one of them; I've already found and selected the best quality components available and appropriate for the game. If fewer than 1,000 copies are needed, they'll be DriveThruCards' Premium cards (Arjo-Wiggins Playper 305gsm matte with blackcore layer), and if we exceed that number, the overseas manufacturer I've been in contact with will use the same exact card stock—if the project is wildly more successful than that, I certainly won't consider anything lower quality. Also, again under ~1k copies, the boxes will be double-deck tuck boxes from the highest quality POD printer I could find, printed on their stiffest board (14pt), while my overseas manufacturer will give only slightly better results and slightly thicker board (15pt). For the rules I went through several options during development but the highest-quality option I could find was having 3.5x5" rule booklets printed, so that's what I'm including in the game; I could have gone with the cheaper option of 11x17" color copies, folded down to fit the tuck boxes, but as with seeking out the best color reproduction, printing, card stock, and box, I only want Teratozoic to be the best I can offer.
Consequently, there are no stretch goals for this project.
((In an earlier iteration, the game only featured 2 main colors of monsters. I was thinking the orange monsters (and support for a 5th & 6th player) would be an expansion/add-on, and further thought I'd make it a stretch goal (among many considered stretch goals) to add the expansion to everyone's reward. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While I have over a decade's experience producing print-ready files for my books, I've been working with card and box printers for less than a year. Much of my experience carries over, and I've been ordering a lot of proofs/prototypes to be sure that everything comes out the way I expect, but it's still entering a new medium, with new challenges. Additionally, for volumes between 50 and about 1,000 copies I plan on working with SuperiorPOD for production of the game's tuck boxes and rule books—I've been happy with their output and have had some success communicating with them, but I'm aware there are horror stories floating around the web, and it's certainly possible there could be problems, delays, or even changes in the specs of the final product if things don't work out with them.

And while I have a lifetime of experience assembling, packing and shipping hundreds to thousands of packages a day, I'm still planning on doing the majority of the work myself, and I'm just one person. I'm sure my wife and friends will offer to help, but it's possible that shipping will take longer than expected—especially if there are thousands of backers, or lots of international backers. Knowing the scale of the project as soon as funding closes, I expect to be able to effectively estimate and communicate to backers any possible delays due to increased scale.

Communication is key; I've backed projects that are great at communicating changes, challenges, and delays, and I've backed projects that go silent for months when you're expecting a delivery or at least an email—and I plan to keep backers up-to-date with information every step of the way. If things don't go exactly as planned (and even if they do!), backers will know about it through project updates.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Core Worlds Digital will be initially released on the iOS platform for both iPhone and iPad, with an Android version available shortly afterwards.
The ancient Galactic Realm, ruled from the Core Worlds of the galaxy, is waning. Now, the barbaric kingdoms that lie beyond the galactic frontier are amassing their strength, choosing this pivotal moment to strike at the heart of the fading republic, establishing new empires built upon the ashes of decaying civilizations. 
But these outer systems are not yet strong enough to engage the forces of the Core Worlds directly. The young kingdoms must first gnaw at the edges of the crumbling frontier, developing new types of units and shrewder tactics. They must build up their energy resources to launch magnificent fleets and overwhelming ground forces. Then, when the time is right, they must strike at the galactic core itself, claiming the most exalted planets for themselves. The barbarian kingdom that achieves these goals will carve out the greatest empire in the galaxy.
Each player controls a barbarian Star Empire. Throughout the game, players will invade Worlds and draft new Units and Tactics into their Empires. Each Unit and World you acquire is worth a certain number of Empire Points. The player whose Empire contains the most Empire Points at the end of the game is the winner!
Core Worlds Digital is a game based on the original Core Worlds deck-building card game. The following are the central concepts of Core Worlds Digital: 
Central Zone: Throughout the game, new Units and Tactics are drawn from the five Galactic Decks in the Central Zone, the game's common play area. These draftable items include new Units and Tactics that the players can draft into their Empires, as well as Worlds that they can invade and conquer. 
Main UI
Empire: Each player represents an Empire that begins with a Home World and a Starting set of Units and Tactics. A player's Empire consists of all of the cards in his hand, draw pile, discard pile, and Warzone (tableau). 
War Room
Fleet Strength: Each World possesses a Fleet Strength that represents the starships that defend it from attack. A World's Fleet Strength must be matched in order for that World to be successfully invaded. Many Units possess a Fleet Strength that a player can use to invade a World. 
Fleet Cruiser
Ground Strength: Each World possesses a Ground Strength that represents the infantry and other ground forces that defend it from surface assault. A World's Ground Strength must be matched in order for it to be successfully invaded. Many Units possess a Ground Strength that a player can use to invade a World. 
Ground Unit
Invasion: In order to add new Worlds to his Empire, a player must launch Invasions. A player performs an Invasion by discarding enough units from his Warzone in combination with any tactics to match the Fleet Strength and Ground Strength of the World he is invading. 
Invasion
Warzone: Each player's Empire includes a Warzone, an area in front of the player where her conquered Worlds are displayed. Players also deploy Units from their hands into their Warzones, and later use these Units to invade new Worlds.
Planet Quetzalcoatl
Core Worlds Digital will allow for a new streamlined, interactive, and engaging cinematic experience for all users. Core Worlds Digital will include multiplayer support via Game Center, AI opponents, pass-and-play, tournament play, match play, in-game rewards and limited edition cards that will allow you to customize the look and feel of your empire. Experience the beautiful artwork of the original table top game, intuitive UI and an interactive 3D experience that brings the Core Worlds to life. Core Worlds Digital takes an "easy set up & play" approach that appeals to both avid and casual gamers!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Although we are passionate about traditional board games, as well as video games, we understand that replicating that "in-person" experience a board games allows for is a tall task. Fortunately the unified expertise that we have with Stronghold Games & BrokenMyth Studios will allow us to approach this project from all angles. 

We believe that one of the most challenging aspect of development will be building an intuitive AI that allows for a challenging single player experience. But with your support and feedback, we're confident we will achieve our goals!
